events.comment:
Lower two are temporarly disabled due to conflicting with events from above
Possible soluions:
Create a custom cursor to eliminate issue

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: VegeTato, arthuro555
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RepeatEveryXSeconds
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This allows to trigger an event every X seconds.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Convenience conditions, actions and behaviors for timers to trigger a condition every X seconds.

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers every X seconds.
eventsFunctions.name: Repeat

parameters.description: The name of the timer to loop
parameters.name: timerName

parameters.description: The time in seconds between each trigger
parameters.name: time

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers every X seconds X amount of times.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Repeat every X seconds in X number
eventsFunctions.name: RepeatXTimes

parameters.description: The name of the timer to loop
parameters.name: timerName

parameters.description: The time in seconds between each trigger
parameters.name: time

parameters.longDescription: The condition will trigger at most this amount of times. Make it -1 for looping forever.
parameters.name: limit

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allows to repeat an object timer every X seconds.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: RepeatTimer

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers every X seconds, where X is defined in the behavior properties.
eventsFunctions.name: Repeat

eventsFunctions.description: Pauses a recurring timer.
eventsFunctions.name: Pause

eventsFunctions.description: Resumes a paused recurring timer.
eventsFunctions.name: Resume

eventsFunctions.description: Allows to trigger the recurring timer X times again.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetLimit
eventsFunctions.sentence: Allow to trigger the recurring timer _PARAM1_ of _PARAM0_ X times again

propertyDescriptors.label: The name of the timer to repeat
propertyDescriptors.name: TimerName

propertyDescriptors.label: The time between each trigger (in seconds)
propertyDescriptors.name: TimerLength

propertyDescriptors.label: How many times should the timer trigger? -1 for forever.
propertyDescriptors.name: Limit

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Bouh, @arthuro555
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CursorType
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Provides an action to change the type of the cursor, and a behavior to change the cursor when an object is hovered.
description: Provides an action to change the type of the cursor, and a behavior to change the cursor when an object is hovered.
Find the list of cursors here: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor

eventsFunctions.description: Change the type of the cursor.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeCursorType

events.comment:
Set as variable instead of directly setting as a CursorHover behavior can override it.
By using a variable, we ensure to be able to change it back to that "default" after the override is over.
Reset ordering as the object with highest Z-Order might not exist anymore or be not be hovered anymore.
Set default value of the default cursor if the variable has just been created

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Change the cursor appearence when the object is hovered (on Windows, macOS or Linux).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: CursorHover

events.comment: Check the z Order to ensure the cursor shown is the one from the foremost object

inlineCode: // Set cursor to behavior property cursor_type

propertyDescriptors.label: The cursor type
propertyDescriptors.description: See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor for a list of possible cursors.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ButtonStates
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Use any object as a button and change appearance according to user interactions.
description: Use the "Button states" behavior to track user interactions with an object, including:
Add additional behaviors to make juicy buttons with animated responses to user input:

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Gamepads
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add support for gamepads (or other controllers) to your game, giving access to information such as button presses, axis positions, trigger pressure, etc...
description: Add support for gamepads (or other controllers).
- automatic mappers for platformer characters and top-down movement
The Bomberman-like example handles 4 players with gamepads ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://goose-bomberman)).

eventsFunctions.description: Get the value of the pressure on a gamepad trigger.
eventsFunctions.name: TriggerPressure

eventsFunctions.description:
Get the rotation value of a gamepad stick.
If the deadzone value is high, the angle value is rounded to main axes, left, left, up, down.
An zero deadzone value give a total freedom on the angle value.
eventsFunctions.name: StickRotationValue

eventsFunctions.description:
Return the angle of a gamepad stick.
If the deadzone value is high, the angle value is rounded to main axes, left, left, up, down.
An zero deadzone value give a total freedom on the angle value.
